description: two standing women at left; leftmost woman has her hands over her face; rightmost woman looks up at legs of crucified Christ on cross; women wear dark and light blue and salmon robes; seated writing figure in LRC
provenance: John E. Andrus III (Wayzata, Minn.); Julie Andrus (Minneapolis, Minn.)
text: Two mourners stand at the foot of the cross, where we see only Jesus’s lower extremities. They may be the Virgin Mary and Mary Magdalene. The figure at the lower right appear to be John the Evangelist. We do not know who made this stirring image.
title: Mourners at the Foot of the Cross
